title: How to Paint an Old Wooden Chair

steps.title: Wash the chair.
steps.content: Wash the chair. [1] X Expert Source Ez's Painting LLC Painting Professionals Expert Interview. 12 January 2022. Use a cloth dipped in soap and water to remove any cobwebs, debris or dirt build-up on your wood chair. If there is a grease build-up, use a grease remover followed with a water rinse. Allow the chair to air dry completely. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Sand the chair to create a smooth painting surface, if needed.
steps.content: Sand the chair to create a smooth painting surface, if needed. [3] X Expert Source Ez's Painting LLC Painting Professionals Expert Interview. 12 January 2022. If your chair is covered with chipping paint, use a coarse grit sandpaper to remove the larger pieces, then use graduating levels of finer grits until you reach the desired finish. Sand out light scratches and dings, as they will show when you paint your chair. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Fill any holes with wood putty.
steps.content: Fill any holes with wood putty. [5] X Research source If the blemishes are too deep to be removed with sanding alone, apply wood putty to the marks and allow it to dry per the manufacturer's instructions. Once dry, sand the excess putty away until your surface is smooth.

steps.title: Tack off the chair.
steps.content: Tack off the chair. Use a tack cloth or slightly damp cotton cloth to remove the dust from sanding. [6] X Expert Source Ez's Painting LLC Painting Professionals Expert Interview. 12 January 2022. Allow the chair to air dry before proceeding.

steps.title: Pick a color or color scheme for your chair.
steps.content: Pick a color or color scheme for your chair. Use a solid color, or a combination of contrasting or complementary colors. [7] X Research source For a whimsical look, paint the seat one color, the back another and the legs another. For subtle touches, paint the entire chair a solid color, then apply accents, such as striping or polka dots, using an alternate color or 2.

steps.title: Place the chair on a drop-cloth to protect the surface below from paint spatter and drips.
steps.content: Place the chair on a drop-cloth to protect the surface below from paint spatter and drips. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Apply Primer.
steps.content: Apply Primer. [9] X Expert Source Ez's Painting LLC Painting Professionals Expert Interview. 12 January 2022. Stir the paint thoroughly before applying. [10] X Research source Use a brush that's easy to hold and small enough to fit between all of the chair's components. It's typically easiest to turn the chair upside down and paint the legs first. When finished, stand the chair on back on its legs and paint the remainder of the chair.

steps.title: Allow to dry and apply additional coats as needed.
steps.content: Allow to dry and apply additional coats as needed. Use spray paint for fast results. Be sure to shake the canisters thoroughly before applying. Use several light coats rather than 1 heavy coat as this discourages drips.

steps.title: Apply your chosen paint.
steps.content: Apply your chosen paint. [11] X Research source Use several light coats rather than 1 heavy coat as this discourages drips.

steps.title: Cover your newly painted wooden chair with a protective clear coat.
steps.content: Cover your newly painted wooden chair with a protective clear coat. Depending on the desired finish, use a matte, satin, or gloss coating. [12] X Expert Source Ez's Painting LLC Painting Professionals Expert Interview. 12 January 2022. A spray finish is easy to apply, but a brush-on finish offers more control for even application. If you plan to add decorative decals to your newly painted chair, apply them before applying the protective clear finish. Allow the clear coating to dry per the manufacturer's instructions, and apply as many coats as desired. [13] X Research source
